title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of （q-2)/2 and $$\frac{2q-7}{18}$$ is $$18$$.
speech: The least common denominator of （q-2)/2 and  fraction, 2 q minus 7, over 18,   is  18 .
pacedSpeech: The least common denominator of （q-2)/2 and   fraction, 2 q minus 7, over 18,

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$9(q-2)=2q-7$$.
speech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get  9 times, parentheses q minus 2,  is equal to, 2 q minus 7 .
pacedSpeech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get   9 times,  q minus 2,  is equal to, 2 q minus 7

title: Isolate q on One side
text: We can further simplify $$9(q-2)=2q-7$$ to $$9q-18=2q-7$$. By subtracting 2q, we get $$7q-18=-7$$. We can add $$18$$ both sides and get $$7q=11$$. Lastly, we can divide both sides by $$7$$ and get $$q=\frac{11}{7}$$ as the final answer.
speech: We can further simplify  9 times, parentheses q minus 2,  is equal to 2 q minus, 7  to  9 q, minus 18 is equal to 2 q minus, 7 . By subtracting 2q, we get  7 q, minus 18 is equal to, negative 7 . We can add  18  both sides and get  7 q is equal to, 11 . Lastly, we can divide both sides by  7  and get  q is equal to 11 sevenths  as the final answer.
